title: Walgreens shares rise after earnings beat
text: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. WBA, +1.78% shares rose 1.6% in Monday premarket trading after the pharmacy retailer reported fourth-quarter earnings and sales that beat expectations. Net income totaled $677.0 million, or 75 cents per share, down from $1.51 billion, or $1.55 per share, last year. Adjusted EPS was $1.43, ahead of the FactSet consensus for $1.41. Sales of $34.0 billion were up from $33.4 billion last year and ahead of the FactSet guidance for $33.9 billion. Walgreens raised its annual cost savings target to more than $1.8 billion by fiscal 2022, versus a previous target of $1.5 billion. Walgreens shares have fallen nearly 19% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.41% is up 20.6%.
